Operation 'get_/media/math/formula/{hash}' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details. Current description is too brief and lacks context about the hash origin and what data is returned. Added clarification about the hash source (x-resource-location header from check endpoint), explicit mention of return value (TeX formula string and metadata), and use case context. This helps AI agents understand the operation's role in the formula workflow and when to use it.

data.current_description:
Returns the previously-stored formula via `/media/math/check/{type}` for the given hash.

Stability: [stable](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API_versioning#Stable).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a previously-stored TeX formula using its hash identifier. The hash is obtained from the `x-resource-location` header returned by the `/media/math/check/{type}` POST endpoint. Returns the original TeX formula string and associated metadata. This endpoint is useful for retrieving formula source code after validation.
data.reasoning: Current description is too brief and lacks context about the hash origin and what data is returned.
